info.name: LibertyPost
info.description: For the news forum LibertyPost.  Overrides the TABLE layout of the sidebar and NavBar to create scrollable gradient-filled semi-transparent popup menus.  Which sounds much grander than it actually is.
info.additionalInfo:
I've marked out in comments where users might want to remove some stuff I've just been dinking with.  Pinguinite forums are broken on the RA_Article SPANs. As with RA_Comment SPANs, both should be changed to DIVs.

This style has been tested on Mac and on Windows using Firefox v3.6 - v34 with generally consistent results.  All the features work on the Mac version (abbreviating huge articles and huge comments into a scrollable text box, so you don't have to scroll wildly to get past some really long post.)  When that SPAN/DIV bug is fixed, this will be more straightforward.

12-14-2011 - made the NavBar "float" (not scroll with the page).  I included comments to tell how to modify it back to a non-floating menu, i.e. pinned to the upper left of the page.  I also changed the A top: positions to use a a:nth-child(0n+1) selector to reduce CPU use for positioning the items in the NavBar.

1-17-2012 - added libertypost.net to the domain's scope.

1-1-2014 - I added support for the latest version of Firefox v34 and did the minor changes needed to accommodate gradient backgrounds in Chrome v39. On 1/5/14, I had to add a bit to accommodate a new menu item, Contact.
